[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Function: from_file()] [Missing Signature Verification] If error maps are distributed across the network, does from_file() verify a cryptographic signature before loading, or can malicious peers distribute fake error maps that cause validators to misinterpret consensus errors? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Function: to_file()] [Plaintext Storage] Are error descriptions stored in plaintext in the BCS-encoded file, potentially leaking sensitive information about unreleased features or vulnerability details in error messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Function: get_explanation()] [Gas Cost Inconsistency] If get_explanation() is called during transaction execution and charged gas, can variations in error map size across validators cause inconsistent gas costs for the same transaction, breaking deterministic execution? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Function: get_explanation()] [No Gas Metering] If get_explanation() performs expensive lookups but isn't gas-metered, can an attacker craft transactions that abort frequently, causing validators to spend excessive CPU on error lookups without paying gas? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Struct: ErrorMapping] [State Bloat] If error maps are stored in global state and grow without bounds, can this contribute to state bloat, increasing storage costs for all validators and potentially making full nodes infeasible to run? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/errmap.rs] [Function: add_module_error()] [Initialization Cost] If add_module_error() is called during module initialization and the cost is charged to module publishers, can attackers drain publisher gas by forcing them to register thousands of error codes?
